resources.string: Allows you to communicate with FMD via a PIN. This allows you to send commands from a phone number that is not in the Allowed Contacts list.
Used as confirmation before wiping the device and for anonymous usage of the service.
The command used to communicate with the FMD.
Select a ringtone that will be played when "fmd ring" is sent.
Lock Screen Message:\nWhen locking the device, this message will appear on the lock screen.
You need the user ID to find your device with FMD Server. Write it down and keep it safe.
This will delete all data from the Server! Are you sure?
Sending commands from FMD Server to your phone requires a UnifiedPush distributor app. Install one, and then return here. It will automatically be detected.
FMD uploads the device\'s location every X minutes.

The source(s) from which the location data is uploaded at regular intervals in the background.\nIf none is selected, no locations are uploaded regularly. (You can still use the web interface to force an upload. This requires push.)
Upload the location of this device when the battery level goes low. This requires Notification Access.
At least server version {MIN} is required, but the selected server has version {CURRENT}. Continue at your own risk.

With FMD Server you can send commands over the internet, from the server to the app. You can also view the device location on a map or view pictures taken by the device. For self-hosting instructions, see the website.
Private instances may require a secret token. Leave this empty if the instance is public.
The contacts in this list are allowed to send FMD commands via SMS. Commands from everyone else will be ignored.
No allowed contacts. Click the button to add some!
Select one of the phone numbers.

Congratulations. You have added your first contact. You can now communicate with FMD by sending a SMS message that contains \"fmd\" from the allowed phone number. When everything works, the application will respond.

FMD can use the OpenCelliD service to get an approximate location based on the cell tower that the phone is connected to. An internet connection is required for every location query. You also need to create an account at OpenCelliD and get your own API Access Token.
Privacy: keep in mind that OpenCelliD learns your current cell tower and thus your location with every API query.

FMD (Find My Device) allows you to remotely locate your device. You can communicate with FMD over SMS, instant messengers, or using FMD Server. Locate your device, make it ring, lock it, or wipe it - all from remote.
You need to update some settings to continue using FMD. Click to open.

Unregistering failed with the following error: {ERROR}\n\nYou can continue anyway, but your account might not have been deleted from the server. If you continue, your account will be deleted locally from this device.

Takes a picture of with the front/back camera and uploads it to FMD Server. Currently only uploading to FMD Server is supported. You can send this command via other transport channels, too, and the picture will be uploaded to FMD Server (if an account exists).
Cannot take picture: no FMD Server account exists.
"The device is taking a picture and will send it to FMD Server. You can view it here soon: %s

This wipes all data. Afterwards you will no longer be able to communicate with the device. To prevent accidental and malicious usage, this command requires a password and it needs to be explicitly enabled in the settings.
Cannot delete: delete command is not enabled in settings.
The device should now be deleted. Goodbye!

Locate the device using one or more location providers. The operating system provider is usually GPS, sometimes with a combination of other sources. A second provider is OpenCelliD, which uses a database of cell tower locations.
Lock the device and optionally show a message on the lockscreen. After this, biometric unlock is disabled and your device password is required to unlock the device.
The device should now be locked.
The device should now be ringing.
Toggle Do Not Disturb on or off
Do Not Disturb mode turned on.
Do Not Disturb mode turned off.
Get network statistics from the device. For example, its IP address and a list of surrounding Wifi networks.

This permission can only be granted with Android\'s \"pm grant\" command line tool. You can execute this command manually via the Android Debug Bridge (ADB) using a computer. You can also execute it directly on your device using root or Shizuku.
This application is supposed to work in the background. To ensure it works even when your phone is in standby, you need to turn off battery optimization for this app.
FMD will occasionally send you notifications, for example to warn you that someone is locating your device.
Send commands to your phone over SMS. E.g., text \"fmd help\" to your phone. FMD will reply with an SMS.

Only phone numbers that are in the allowlist can send commands. To send commands from a phone number that is not in the allowlist, you have to include the PIN: \"fmd mypin help\". For convenience, so that you don\'t have to re-type the PIN every time, this new phone number is added to a temporary allowlist for the next 10 minutes.
SMS may incur costs for both you and the person texting you. SMS requires your SIM card to be unlocked (e.g., after a reboot).

You can allow FMD to read your notifications to listen for commands. FMD can then reply via Android\'s built-in notification reply feature. This allows you to control FMD using a messaging application of your choice, as long as it posts notifications that can be replied to. E.g., you can send a Signal message \"fmd mypin help\" to your phone.
Controlling FMD via Notification Reply requires the FMD PIN to be set. Every message must contain the correct PIN.

FMD Server provides a web interface to control your phone, view its location, and view pictures it sent. You can self-host FMD Server or use the provided instance. Data is stored encrypted on the server, protected by your password.
Anyone who knows your username and password can log in to FMD Server and control your phone.
FMD Server requires your phone to have an internet connection. This can be a mobile network (thus the SIM needs to be unlocked) or WiFi.
Notifications when FMD is receiving commands
Notifications when FMD is accessed is via the PIN
Notifications when something fails, like the connection to FMD Server
FindMyDevice\nThis phone is locked!\nMessage from the owner:
GPS coordinates will be sent soon.
" locate - sends the current location of the phone"
Error gaining location from OpenCelliD. Please try the following the link. The parameters you want are \"lon\" and \"lat\".
Empty Command not allowed\n Returning to default.[fmd]

Here you can configure the application to communicate with FMDserver. If you want to configure a different server than default, you can do so by changing the URL. If you press "register" you can register the application to the server. Afterwards you can enable the server functionality. If you do so, your phone will send you location data to the specified server. You can check your phone\'s location by entering the ID and the password on the page.
" GPS (on/off) - turns the GPS on or off."
Sorry the application is not allowed to do so.
" expert - help page for expert commands."
" Sound (on/off) - turns the sound on or off."
" Camera (front/back) - takes a picture and sends it to FMDserver."
"The device will soon send a picture to fmdserver. You can view it here soon: "
This device isn\'t registered on a server.
